content:
Posted: February 9, 2015
												I'm not too sure what people were expecting with this collection, but from the reviews I hvae read, you people have been far too harsh for what it is and when it was made.Moto Racer 1 is a PS1 game which, I believe, was ported to the PC (or released at the same time as the PS1 version). The graphics are old and it's going to have the odd glitch and incompatibility now and then. Anyone without common sense should know that your 'Octa core processor with SLI'd GTX 770s' would have compatibility issues with a game from the 90s.Additionally, you cannot expect a game that was made for the PS1 to be fancy. If a HD remake was produced, the original old-school gamers who played this game probably wouldn't have liked it. Why expect a game or a collection that's released onto Steam to be new and sparkly? Developers ARE allowed to release old games onto Steam.So overall, I recommend this merely because I congratulate the developers for releasing this great PS1 game onto Steam. I've played all of the games in this collection enough in my childhood and away from Steam to know this deserves a recommendation even if Steam says I've only played for less than an hour.

Posted: July 22, 2015
												Got this game on the Week long sale on 20/07/2015. First thing I gotta say, yes, it works. All the games loaded an run. I do agree with other reviews saying that they could have tried to make it more compatible. There are unplayable areas (mostly when you're playing a dirt race with many competitors on screen) and MASSIVE slowdowns... Could be better.Now the biggest reason for the Negative review: they f*** up Moto Racer 2! Why was the great, perfect soundtrack changed? WHY? I do believe I left Moto Racer's 2 CD more time in my Stereo then in the PC, just for how great the soundtrack is. Then I load the game with high expectations for a battery solo to start the video and I get a totally souless music in a new intro video, and then the menu screen hits and where is the beautiful Punk Rock music? This should be advertised as it is on GOG. I would not have spent not even the less then a dollar I did. Total lack of respect with the game fans.

content:
Posted: February 27, 2015
												First off, I will admit that after the download, Moto Racer 1 did not work UNTIL, after about 2 minutes of googling, I found the fix (I will put the link at the end of this review. Notes on the fix will also be at the end). I only bought this game for nostalgia, and boy did it deliver! The graphics are not too hot, but that is because these games are old (Moto Racer 1 came out in 1997). I don't recommend this game to people looking for simulators, but if you like easy-to-load, fast-paced arcade bike racing games, then these are for you!THIS IS JUST FOR MOTO RACER ONE      https://steamcommunity.com/app/324110/discussions/0/613938575207390002/?insideModal=1    There's the link to the fix. It's a super easy fix to do, but it was found in a version not on Steam version (Duh!), so the only problem that I found was in the middle of a championship race when it said "Illegal Version" and I couldn't accelerate. The single races and time trials have all worked. I don't think I will be able to unlock maps since I can't advance in the championship, but there is an "unlock all tracks" cheat online, so I did that.

number of helpful: 44 of 47 people (94%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: November 13, 2014
												Hey fellow steam users!I bought this on 11/13/2014 and I have tested both Moto Racer 1, 2, 3, and 4 are all playable. Here's my review for each one:1. Moto racer, the bonafide classic. not many tracks, but the game is wonderful, old-school, and arcadey. A definate must-have! 4:3 only, use the "black bars" mode.2. Just like its predecessor, this game is wonderful and fast and arcadey. Much more tracks this time around, but the game is a tad more realistic and not quite as arcadey as MR1. If you add custom widescreen resolutions lower than 1024x768, usually they appear in-game.3. Moto Racer 3 is a departure from the second one as there is a heavier focus on "arcade realism". The COD of the Moto Racer series, but this game is very enjoyable still and as always, has a wonderful sense of speed. 4:3 only.4. The classic from ios, this game was created with auto-acceleration in mind. Play this with a controller and don't be as heavy on the throttle! The shoulder buttons are best for acceleration as button A is hard-coded to be Boost. 4x3 only, just like the older versions. This game is fairly faithful to its predecessors and is a good time waster, but not quite as good as the originals.Overall, i'd say if you are a fan of the series, by all means get this title. It's cheaper than buying each one on GOG, and it's great fun for all ages!The game had extreme bugs on release, but on my windows 8.1, amd fx 8350, and nvidia gtx 660, these games run fine and have few problems.

number of helpful: 85 of 122 people (70%) found this review helpful5 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: October 3, 2014
												This is a collection, so be aware that the original games have not been improved upon.The store page is not ambiguous about that, but I'd rather reiterate because you might have different expectations in this age of HD remakes.Having loved the original Moto Racer back in the day, a straight port was fine by me, except...Moto Racer 1 won't launch on my machine -- launcher fails to set colour depth. There might be a way around it, like setting my display to 16-bit manually, but I can't be arsed right now. I might put effort into finding a workaround later though, because I recall this one being my favourite.Moto Racer 2 does launch, but there's no sound during races, no music or SFX. Plays well, but feels weird because of that.Moto Racer 3 works (huzzah!). Don't think I played this one back in the day (or not much); it seems less arcadey and fun than the previous two instalments, but that's just my impression after a single race. Moto Racer 15th anniversary is the most recent entry (you can tell it's modern because you accelerate with the right trigger, not the A button!) and it's utter garbage. Not only does it manage to be uglier than the other, way older entries, but more shamefully it plays poorly. Not the game I cared about anyway, but dang, morbid curiosity is the only reason to bother trying it at all -- and even then I couldn't finish a single lap in a cross race. The way it handles just feels entirely wrong, like someone's first Unity game on XBLIG.So all in all, if I find a way to make sound work in 2 and for 1 to launch at all, maybe I'll spend some time with this, reminiscing. But I cannot recommend it in good faith.(Oh, and I spent more than 5 minutes with this -- but Steam only counts time spent in the launcher apparently)

content:
Posted: February 16, 2015
												It is unbelieveable, how much crap the people are writing, without getting their stuff fixed themself. Sorry about that, but it is really necessary to explain everyone, how wrong the negative reviews are! 1. All parts of Moto Racer got controller support! Even the 3rd is playable with the XBOX360 Controller! You can change the controls in every part. From Moto Racer 1 - 3! Just check the configuration settings in the games (or launcher in the 3rd part).2. There was nowhere written, that this collection is a remake or a HD release, so complaining about that is totally unnecessary! With the right settings and a little engine modding the games look really good!3. There are no soundbugs at all. The people complaining about that, are just using some random codecpacks, so the game doesn't work right. I got a Realtek HD Onboard Soundcard and no sound problems at all. Everywhere is sound...even in the movies! Config your computers right, then you won't have that problems!4. The AI is too hard?....NOPE...you are just too weak! Easy AI is easy! 5. The games work like a charm on Win7 x64! No problems, no crashes, no complains! They work even better, then they were on Win95/98/MeThe collection is perfect. If you liked Moto Racer back in the old days, you will feel really nostalgic playing this collection.  I had a smile on my face in every part of the collection. It was like being a child again. Really fun! I will spend more time playing this collection, since it is a really good revive of the good old Moto Racer games! Totally recommending it!

content:
Posted: February 27
												When you press "PLAY" button it opens up a small menu window where you can select Moto Racer 1 - 4. Steam only tracks the menu, not the actual game you play but the menu only last until you select the game so it's not easy to write a review unless you leave the menu on for awhile.OK now, on to to more relevant review. Mostly no problem to run on my laptop except Moto Racer 3. The error message leads you to think that it's a driver or Direct-x problem. Actually it's a monitor resolution issue. Re-directing output to an external monitor and selecting 1280x960 resolution fixed this. Also might be needed is to manually assign texture memory in the advanced options. Mine had to be set at 256 MB, the default 32 MB didn't work.Update Mar 2, 2017Found out that the critical setting needed is Anti-Aliasing; it must be other than off. Another issue that may cause it to crash to desktop is if you have a game recorder in recording mode while the game transitions between menu and gameplay mode. Avoid the crash by turning off the recording function before entering the race and turning it back on as soon you enter the game mode. 1024x768 works and default 32 MB textures also work as long as AA is on. Game runs fine with the game recorder in recording mode, just remember to turn it off in the transition from menu to game mode. Although the gameplay can be recorded and it looks fine while playing, there is a problem with the recorded video; it's jittery. Haven't found a fix for it yet. Note that frame rate is capped at 33 fps.End of updateMoto Racer Anniversary Edition has no replay view but Moto Racer 3 does. It has some semblance of realism but it's mostly arcadey physics which is to be expected. The key is to play at the proper resolution and setting so that it's not too fast, otherwise bike control would be too twitchy on the keyboard.Steam has a very good offer at 80% off at the moment but here is a better offer: https://www.bundlestars.com/en/bundle/microids-mega-bundle-30th-anniversaryNo i'm not paid to recommend Bundle Stars deal, i'm just sharing info in case you're interested.It's quite fun and way cheaper than MotoGP series. You have the option to race on the road with traffic which is absent in MotoGP and Ride. I assume it would have better compatibility with older systems.6.5/10Minor update March 20, 2017For some reason Moto Racer 3 no longer works. I suspect this has to do with the latest AMD driver Non-WHQL Crimson 16.2.1 driver package or some Windows updates that was recently installed. Will update again later if i can fix it.Minor update March 31 2017It works again, just as i thought. Older AMD driver version 8.951.0.0 which comes with the catalyst app 12.3 is compatible. Still jittery in the recorded gameplay though.Minor update April 2 2017Found a fix for the jittery recorded video - Use FRAPS. Hah! it's that simple, to think that i spent so much time fiddling with graphics settings, different drivers and encoding methods. Here is the result:


YouTube™ Video: Moto Racer 3 - Eastern Creek, gameplay & replay 

			Views: 3		

			Easy AI wasn't so easy for me, i had an easier time with SBK and MotoGP series. Physics is ok, it's not too arcadey and the bike banking is more responsive than other bike games.		

Before i forget; Moto Racer 3 works offline without Steam, not sure about the rest.

number of helpful: 17 of 31 people (55%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 20, 2014
												The Moto Racer games were a staple of my childhood. The CD for the first game is probably still at my parent's house somewhere. And the games themselves are still reasonably fun, if not very dated.But this collection is abysmal. It's honestly amazing how lazy this collection is. First, there's the launcher. The launcher is the laziest part of this collection. It was very obviously made with Windows forms (So I doubt we'll ever see a Mac or Linux port of this), and was made by someone who spent maybe 15 minutes on it. It's just a drop-down menu that lets you pick a game, and sometimes the language. They didn't even change the default icon for goodness' sake! In an hour, I could teach a programmer how to make a better launcher than this...But let's talk about the games. But with the first Moto Racer, the launcher won't even launch the game! If you go into the installation directory and launche the game there, it will work. But besides the issues with launching the game, it has not been changed. It's just as good as I remember it, but it's controller support has not been updated for modern controllers. Running it with an Xbox 360 controller, the turns are way too fast. You can get used to it, though.Moto Racer 2 does not allow turning with anything other than a controller for me (Which has aforementioned sensitivity issues). This game is a marked improvment over the first though, even if it's not been changed since it was released. Moto Racer 3 is the first one so far to run without any issues! It's not as good as Moto Racer 1 or 2 though. Moto Racer: 15th Anniversary is...there's no way to put this lightly, the worst in the series. It's a port of a mobile game, and it shows: Poor production values; bland and uninspired graphics; and very, very bad AI. There's nothing really enjoyable here. In all, this is a poor collection of great games. If you want to experience the Moto Racer games, just get them from GOG. If this collection ever gets updated to be less abysmal, I will update this review.

												옛 추억에 잠겨서 바로 구입을 해서 플레이를 해봤는데추억을 아주 확실히 되새김질할 수 있게 예전 버전을 고스란히 올려놓았습니다.현대 pc 환경은 전혀 고려하지 않은 채 그 때 그 시절의 해상도와 그래픽을 유지하였네요.아무튼 실행은 되니까 그래픽은 건너뛰고 1편부터 해보았습니다.1편은 스테이지 2부터 제대로 즐기지도 못합니다.그래픽적 세부 효과가 나타나면서 동시에 게임이 끊겨버립니다.주행을 정상적으로 할 수가 없습니다.게임 내 CD 배경음악은 재생조차 되지 않습니다.폴더로 가보면 배경음악 파일은 들어있지만 게임 내에서는 전혀 작동하지 않습니다.그래픽 보완은 그렇다 쳐도 게임을 최신 환경에서 구동 테스트를 해보았는지 의심이 듭니다.모음집으로 9.99달러에 올린 건 어찌보면 착한 가격이지만완벽하게 즐기지도 못하는 게임들이니 대폭 할인을 하는 시기에 구입할 것을 강력 추천합니다.
